alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 1:01AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties through 145 AM MDT... At 100 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Bosler to near Pumpkin Vine. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pumpkin Vine and Tie Siding around 110 AM MDT. Bosler and Vedauwoo around 125 AM MDT. Buford and Vedauwoo Campground around 130 AM MDT. Baldy Peak around 140 AM MDT. Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Granite Springs Campground and North Crow Campground around 145 AM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 294 and 346. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
